items: Start by sitting on a calf raise machine with your feet flat on the platform and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
Place a weight on top of your knees, making sure it is secure and won’t fall off during the exercise.
Slowly raise your heels off the platform by extending your ankles as far as possible.
Hold the contraction for a second, then lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Make sure to keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise.
Adjust the weight as necessary to challenge yourself and continue making progress.
Strengthens and tones the calf muscles
Improves ankle stability and balance
Helps prevent injuries such as ankle sprains and strains
Can improve athletic performance in activities such as running, jumping, and dancing
Can be done with weights to increase resistance and challenge the muscles
